WorkItem.ClosedComment: Should be fixed for next release.
WorkItem.Description:
-Tried to select Havoc's Call on my enhancement shaman.
-Weapon didn't exist in cache
-Via Rawr Item Editor, attempted to Add new item with Wowhead id
-Crash occurs.  See exception output.
 
See the end of this message for details on invoking 
just-in-time (JIT) debugging instead of this dialog box.
 
************** Exception Text **************
System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
   at Rawr.Wowhead.GetItem(String site, String query, Boolean filter)
   at Rawr.Wowhead.GetItem(String query, Boolean filter)
   at Rawr.FormItemEditor.AddItemsById(Int32[] ids, Boolean useArmory, Boolean useWowhead)
   at Rawr.FormItemEditor.AddItemById(Int32 id, Boolean useArmory, Boolean useWowhead)
   at Rawr.FormItemEditor.buttonAdd_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnClick(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.OnClick(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.OnMouseUp(MouseEventArgs mevent)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmMouseUp(Message& m, MouseButtons button, Int32 clicks)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.OnMessage(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)
 
 
[edit] Loaded Assemblies not needed.

Comments.Message: We'll look into this crash, however you should go check your filters; Havoc's Call is indeed in the default item cache in 2.3.13.

I've attached my Rawr screenshots.  The first is my filter selections, which you can see that all ICC filters are enabled.  The second is the item editor filtering for Havoc, and it does not appear in the cache.
